sn48.46:1.2: “Mendicants, how many faculties must a mendicant develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:
sn48.46:1.3: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’?”
sn48.46:2.1: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn48.46:2.2: “A mendicant must develop and cultivate two faculties so that they can declare enlightenment.
sn48.46:2.6: For their noble wisdom is the faculty of wisdom.
sn48.46:2.7: And their noble freedom is the faculty of immersion.
sn48.46:2.8: These are the two faculties that a mendicant must develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:
sn48.46:2.9: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’.”
